replies.msg:
Wenger on next move after leaving Arsenal: "I decided not to decide. I was intoxicated for such a long time that I promised myself not to make any decisions before September." [@GFFN via Corse Matin]

Wenger on if he feels like he sacrificed his life: "Yes of course. Being passionate is selfish work. When you are passionate, you steal your time from those whom you love and to whom you could have given much more."

Wenger: "You always fear a little emptiness. But I quickly organised myself in this new stage of my life, I do a lot of sport, I eat with my friends. I can sit for hours contemplating the horizon, I read everyday, right now a book by Philip Roth called 'I Married a Communist'."

quote.msg:
Wenger on next move after leaving Arsenal: "I decided not to decide. I was intoxicated for such a long time that I promised myself not to make any decisions before September." [@GFFN via Corse Matin]

Wenger on if he feels like he sacrificed his life: "Yes of course. Being passionate is selfish work. When you are passionate, you steal your time from those whom you love and to whom you could have given much more."

Wenger: "You always fear a little emptiness. But I quickly organised myself in this new stage of my life, I do a lot of sport, I eat with my friends. I can sit for hours contemplating the horizon, I read everyday, right now a book by Philip Roth called 'I Married a Communist'."

replies.msg: When you are passionate, you steal your time from those whom you love and to whom you could have given much more.

The Mirror claim Emery is understood to have not been happy with Ramsey's performance in the defeat against Manchester City. That was the reason why he was left out against Chelsea. #Arsenal

The Telegraph say with his place in Emery’s starting XI now unsure, #Arsenal face a fight to persuade Ramsey to commit to a new contract.

The Mail say Emery is keen to change #Arsenal's style & wants as much mobility in his midfield as possible, which could leave Ramsey vulnerable.

Arsène Wenger: "Am I proud of my career? Pride has never been my strong point. Proud, in any case, to have always worked with values â€‹â€‹that were important to me, respect for people, seriousness, integrity, sense of responsibility."

Wenger: "I'm not stupid enough either to think that I did not make mistakes & there, we enter the field of some regrets that I could have. On the other hand, I have no remorse because I have stayed true to the values â€‹â€‹that are important in sport, esp in high performance sport."

Wenger: "Ideally, for me, a coach should have an influence on both individual player improvement, style of play and results, club structure and size. In general, this influence can only be effective through the duration of the presence and the power one can have within the club."

Wenger on his bronze statue at the Directors Diamond Club entrance at Emirates Stadium: "I prefer to be alive than a statue, but the initiative was benevolent."

Claude LeRoy: “Arsene and I will be decorated [by President George Weah] with the highest distinction of the country on August 24 in Monrovia.” [AP]

Arsenal manager Unai Emery has admitted that he spoke to former Gunners midfielder Jack Wilshere for just 15 minutes ahead of the home grown player's decision to leave the club as a free agent over the summer, before signing for West Ham.



When Wilshere announced in June his intention to leave Arsenal at the end of his contract, he explained that while he was willing to accept a pay cut in order to stay, a lack of playing time on offer was ultimately what influenced his final decision.
